content.text: 501.1 Scope: Governs materials, design, and installation of water heaters and related safety devices.
501.2 Water heater as space heater: Requires mixing valve (ASSE 1017) if water exceeds 140°F for space heating.
501.3 Drain valves: Must be installed at the bottom of tank-type water heaters; 3/4-inch inlet, male hose thread outlet.
501.4 Location: Must allow access for observation, maintenance, servicing, and replacement.
501.5 Labeling: All water heaters must be third-party certified.
501.6 Temperature control from tankless heaters: Max output 140°F unless overridden by Section 412.3.
501.7 Pressure marking: Tanks must be clearly marked with max working pressure, accessible for inspection.
501.8 Temperature controls: Must be adjustable for the full intended temperature range.
502.1 General: Install per manufacturer instructions and relevant Florida Building Codes.
502.1.1 Elevation/protection: Must comply with code requirements for mechanical and fuel gas systems.
502.2 Plenum restriction: No fuel-burning heaters in rooms used as plenums.
502.3 Attic installations: Must allow access, have a 30x22 inch clear opening, solid flooring, and service space.
502.4 Seismic supports: Reserved.
502.5 Clearances: Must allow inspection and service without removing permanent construction or impairing fire resistance.
503.1 Cold water line valve: Must be accessible, not disrupt cold water to rest of system.
503.2 Circulation: Must enable proper flow through the water heater, conform to material standards.
504.1 Antisiphon devices: Required for all storage water heaters/tanks.
504.2 Vacuum relief valve: Required for bottom-fed heaters/tanks; must comply with ANSI Z21.22.
504.3 Shutdown: NFPA 70-compliant disconnects and fuel shutoff valves required.
504.4 Relief valve: Required for pressurized systems; must comply with ANSI Z21.22; not for thermal control.
504.4.1 Installation: Must be in top 6 inches of tank; no check/shutoff valves allowed between relief valve and tank.
504.5 Relief valve approval: Max temp 210°F, max pressure 150 psi or less; must be agency-labeled.
504.6 Discharge piping requirements
bullet_points: Air gap required in same room.
Discharge to floor, pan, receptor, or outdoors.
Terminate within 6"–2x pipe diam. above receptor.
Allowable size upstep for insert fittings only.

content.text: 504.7 Required pan
bullet_points: Must use galvanized steel (≥0.0236”), aluminum, or plastic (≥0.036”).
Plastic pans not allowed under gas-fired heaters.
Minimum 1.5" depth with 3/4" drain to indirect waste.
Drain terminates at receptor, floor drain, or outside (6"–24" above grade).
Pan not required for replacement installs without existing drain.

content.text: [E] 505.1 Unfired vessel insulation: Must meet R-12.5 (imperial) or R-2.2 (metric).
